problem_text:
For nilpotent subgroups A, B, C of a finite group G, let MinG(A, B, C) be the subgroup of A generated by all minimal by inclusion intersections of the form A ∩ Bx ∩ Cy, where x, y ∈ G, and let minG(A, B, C) be the subgroup of MinG(A, B, C) generated by all intersections of this kind of minimal order.
 a) Is it true that minG(A, B, C) ⩽ F(G)?
 b) Is it true that MinG(A, B, C) ⩽ F(G)?
 c) The same questions for soluble groups.
V. I. Zenkov
